In the case of a CCR exposure in respect of derivative contracts valued in accordance with rule 59 or a CCR exposure in respect of SFTs valued in accordance with rule 60, an authorized institution must not, for subrule (1), take into account the effect of any recognized CRM applicable to the exposure that has already been taken into account in the calculation of the amount of the default risk exposure of the contract or transaction under Part 6A of the Capital Rules.

In the case of a CCR exposure in respect of SFTs valued in accordance with rule 60, an authorized institution that uses the STC approach, or a combination of the STC approach and IRB approach, to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures under the Capital Rules must, for subrule (1), take into account the recognized collateral by using the comprehensive approach to the treatment of recognized collateral.

An authorized institution must not recognize the effect of a recognized CRM if the institution has not taken into account the effect of the same form of recognized credit risk mitigation (as defined by section 2(1) of the Capital Rules) in its calculation of the risk-weighted amount for credit risk in respect of the exposure under the Capital Rules.
The Monetary Authority may, by written notice to an authorized institution, designate the institution as a Category A institution.

subsection.leadIn: The designation may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on the Monetary Authority’s own volition, if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the institution—

subparagraph.content: is internationally active; or
is significant to the general stability and effective working of the banking system in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on application by the institution, if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the institution has the capacity (including systems and resources) to determine an ASC exposure or an ALCG exposure taking into account the effect of credit risk mitigation applicable to a Category A institution.

subsection.leadIn: The designation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subrules (1) and (2), the Monetary Authority may decide not to designate an authorized institution as a Category A institution under the following circumstances—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution’s particular circumstances provide reasonable justification for it not to be designated as a Category A institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it would not materially prejudice the institution’s calculation of an aggregate exposure ratio under this Part if the designation were not made.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution has been designated as a Category A institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority is satisfied that had the designation not been made, the Monetary Authority would not make the designation,

subsection.continued: the Monetary Authority may, on the Monetary Authority’s own volition or on application by the institution, by written notice to the institution, revoke the designation.

subsection.leadIn: The revocation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the event specified in the notice occurs.

subsection.content: A decision made by the Monetary Authority under subrule (1) or (5) is a decision to which section 101B(1) of the Ordinance applies.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Credit risk mitigation—Category A institution
section.content: A Category A institution must adjust the value of a CRM covered exposure of the institution to the value of the CRM uncovered portion of the exposure in accordance with Division 6.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Credit risk mitigation—Category B institution
section.leadIn: A Category B institution must adjust the value of each of the following exposures of the institution to the value of the CRM uncovered portion of the exposure in accordance with Division 6—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a CRM covered exposure that is a CCR exposure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a CRM covered exposure that is a non-CCR exposure, if the recognized CRM that covers the exposure is—

subparagraph.content: a recognized netting done under a valid bilateral netting agreement; or
a recognized collateral that is a cash deposit.

subsection.leadIn: Subrule (2) applies if, in relation to an authorized institution, an entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is the fund manager of 1 or more CISs, in relation to each of which the institution has an exposure arising from its holding of interests under the CIS (except where the custodian of the assets in the scheme is a separate legal entity);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is the liquidity support provider to 1 or more asset-backed commercial paper programmes, in relation to each of which the institution has an exposure arising from its holding of interests under the programme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is the sponsor of 1 or more asset-backed commercial paper programmes, in relation to each of which the institution has an exposure arising from its holding of interests under the programme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is the credit protection provider (through a credit default swap or guarantee) of 1 or more synthetic securitization transactions, in relation to each of which the institution has an exposure arising from its holding of interests under the transaction; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: plays any other role which represents a common risk factor for 1 or more CISs, asset-backed commercial paper programmes, synthetic securitization transactions or similar items, in relation to each of which the institution has an exposure arising from its holding of interests under the CIS, asset-backed commercial paper programme, synthetic securitization transaction or similar item.

subsection.leadIn: The institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is treated as having an exposure to the entity arising from each of the holdings mentioned in subrule (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must, for determining its ASC exposure to the entity—

subparagraph.content: value each of the exposures as equivalent to the current book value of the relevant holding; and
include all of the exposures as non-CCR exposures of the institution.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: asset-backed commercial paper programme (有資產支持的商業票據計劃) has the meaning given by section 227(1) of the Capital Rules;

liquidity facility (流動資金融通) has the meaning given by section 227(1) of the Capital Rules, with the modification that the meaning is in relation to any entity instead of only in relation to an authorized institution;
liquidity support provider (流動資金支援者) means a party that provides liquidity facilities.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Protection seller and protection buyer of credit derivative contract

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution enters into a credit derivative contract as a protection seller; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fair value of the contract is positive from the perspective of the institution (that is, the present value of contracted but not yet paid periodical payment from the protection buyer exceeds the present value of the expected obligation of the protection seller under the contract),

section.continued: the institution must, for determining its ASC exposure to the protection buyer under this Part, include the positive value in calculating the sum of the value of all of the institution’s CCR exposures to the protection buyer.

subsection.leadIn: Subrule (2) applies if an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has offset an exposure in the trading book of the institution against a credit derivative contract mentioned in rule 56(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has taken into account the value of any collateral in valuing a CCR exposure under rule 59 or 60; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has adjusted the value of a CRM covered exposure to the value of the CRM uncovered portion of the exposure in accordance with Division 6.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (3), the institution must include a new exposure to the relevant credit protection provider as follows— (L.N. 169 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: whether the exposure mentioned in subrule (1) (protected exposure) is a CCR exposure or a non-CCR exposure—

subparagraph.content: if the credit protection is in the form of a recognized credit derivative contract or a credit derivative contract mentioned in rule 56(2) and the contract is not a credit default swap mentioned in paragraph (b)—the amount of the reduction in the value of the protected exposure must be included in determining the institution’s ASC exposure to the counterparty of the contract;

if the value of the credit protection, that is in the form of a collateral, is taken into account in valuing the protected exposure under rule 59 or 60—the value so taken into account must be included in determining the institution’s ASC exposure to the issuer of the collateral;

if the credit protection is in the form of a recognized collateral—the amount of the reduction in the value of the protected exposure must be included in determining the institution’s ASC exposure to the issuer of the collateral;

if the credit protection is in the form of a recognized guarantee—the amount of the reduction in the value of the protected exposure must be included in determining the institution’s ASC exposure to the guarantor under the guarantee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the credit protection is in the form of a credit derivative contract mentioned in rule 56(2) that is a credit default swap, and either the counterparty or the reference entity of the contract is not a financial sector entity—an amount equivalent to the default risk exposure to the counterparty calculated as mentioned in rule 59 must be included in determining the institution’s ASC exposure to the counterparty of the contract.

subsection.content: If the recognized credit derivative contract is an internal risk transfer recognized under section 99B of the Capital Rules, a protection provider under the external hedge referred to in that section is to be regarded as the relevant credit protection provider. (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: internal risk transfer (內部風險轉移) has the meaning given by section 99B(4) of the Capital Rules. (L.N. 169 of 2023)

section.name: s55
section.heading: General
section.content: For determining an ASC exposure under this Part, the valuation of an exposure may be subject to offsetting and deduction in accordance with this Subdivision.

subsection.leadIn: A long position and a short position with respect to the same counterparty in an authorized institution’s trading book may be offset as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a long position and a short position in the same issue of securities in the trading book may be offset;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a long position and a short position in different issues of securities in the trading book issued by the same counterparty may be offset, if the long position is senior, or of equivalent seniority, to the short position.

subsection.content: An exposure arising from the holding of securities issued by a counterparty in an authorized institution’s trading book may be offset against a credit derivative contract, in the institution’s trading book, entered into by the institution to hedge the exposure if the position being hedged is senior, or of equivalent seniority, to the reference obligation of the credit derivative contract.

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (1)(a), 2 issues are treated as the same issue if the following (as applicable) are identical—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issuer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: coupon;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: currency;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: maturity;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: priority to claim on the issuer’s income or assets.

subsection.leadIn: For determining the relative seniority of a long position and a short position in different issues of securities under subrules (1)(b) and (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the securities may be allocated into broad buckets of different degrees of seniority (including, for example, “equity”, “subordinated debt” or “senior debt”);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution chooses to allocate securities in the way mentioned in paragraph (a), the allocation must be applied consistently across the institution’s entire portfolio of positions in its trading book.

subsection.content: A long position with respect to a counterparty in an authorized institution’s banking book may be offset against a short position in an option contract with respect to the counterparty in its banking book.

subsection.leadIn: The following is taken to be zero—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a net short position after any offsetting mentioned in subrule (1)(a) or (b), (2) or (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a short position not used to offset a long position as mentioned in subrule (1)(a) or (b), (2) or (5).

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, an authorized institution may choose not to do any offsetting mentioned in subrule (1)(a) or (b), (2) or (5).

subsection.leadIn: In valuing an exposure of an authorized institution, the following amounts are to be deducted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount that is deducted in determining the capital base of the institution in accordance with the Capital Rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any specific provision made in respect of the exposure, that is not yet considered in valuing the exposure;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for an exposure covered by a recognized collateral, or a recognized guarantee, issued by an exempted sovereign entity—the amount so covered;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for an exposure covered by a letter of comfort where—

subparagraph.content: the letter of comfort is approved by the Monetary Authority; and
the conditions (if any) attached to the approval, whether generally or in any particular case or class of cases, are complied with—

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for an exposure that has been written off in the books of the institution—the amount written off.

subsection.leadIn: If more than 1 deduction under subrule (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) corresponds to the same portion of an exposure, the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must apply only 1 deduction in valuing the exposure; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may choose to use any 1 of paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e) of subrule (1).

section.name: s58
section.heading: Application of Division 4
section.content: This Division applies to the valuation of a CCR exposure of an authorized institution to a counterparty for determining the institution’s ASC exposure to the counterparty.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Derivative contract
section.leadIn: A CCR exposure arising from a derivative contract entered into by an authorized institution with a counterparty is valued at the amount of the default risk exposure calculated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the institution does not use any internal model based approach to calculate the amount of the default risk exposure of its derivative contracts for calculating its capital adequacy ratio under the Capital Rules—by using the approach or method under Part 6A of those Rules that the institution currently uses for that calculation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution uses any internal model based approach to calculate the amount of the default risk exposure of its derivative contracts for calculating its capital adequacy ratio under the Capital Rules—by using the SA-CCR approach.

section.name: s60
section.heading: SFT
section.content: A CCR exposure arising from an SFT entered into by an authorized institution with a counterparty is valued at the amount of the default risk exposure calculated by using the methods set out in Division 2B of Part 6A of the Capital Rules (other than the internal model based approach set out in section 226ML of those Rules).

section.name: s61
section.heading: Application of Division 5
section.content: This Division applies to the valuation of a non-CCR exposure of an authorized institution to a counterparty for determining the institution’s ASC exposure to the counterparty.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Application of Subdivision 2
section.content: This Subdivision applies to a non-CCR exposure arising from an item in an authorized institution’s banking book.

section.name: s63
section.heading: General—current book value
section.content: A non-CCR exposure, arising from an item in an authorized institution’s banking book, must be valued at the item’s current book value, unless this Subdivision or Subdivision 3 contains a provision that specifically provides for the valuation of the exposure.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Shares of company
section.leadIn: A non-CCR exposure, arising from the holding of shares of a company, must be valued at the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the current book value of the shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount that is remaining unpaid on the shares and is not included in the current book value of the shares.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Off-balance sheet exposure other than default risk exposure or exposure arising from unsegregated collateral

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (2), a non-CCR exposure that is an off-balance sheet exposure specified in column 2 of the Table in section 1 of Schedule 6 to the Capital Rules must be valued at the credit equivalent amount of the exposure calculated in accordance with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if an authorized institution uses the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures—section 118(1) of the Capital Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an authorized institution uses the STC approach, or a combination of the STC approach and IRB approach, to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures—section 71(1) of the Capital Rules.

subsection.leadIn: For calculating the credit equivalent amount of an off-balance sheet exposure under subrule (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicable CCF specified in column 3 of the Table in section 1 of Schedule 6 to the Capital Rules is subject to a floor of 10%; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: item 4 in the Table in section 1 of Schedule 6 to the Capital Rules (forward asset purchases) does not include a put option contract written by the institution.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Non-CCR Exposure (Banking Book or Trading Book)

section.name: s66
section.heading: Application of Subdivision 3
section.content: This Subdivision applies to a non-CCR exposure, arising from an item in a book of an authorized institution, irrespective of whether the item is in its banking book or trading book.

subsection.content: This rule applies to the valuation of a non-CCR exposure arising from the assets underlying a specified SFT.

subsection.leadIn: For a specified SFT, an authorized institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: treat the securities sold or lent, or the securities provided as collateral, under the specified SFT as an on-balance sheet exposure of the institution as if the institution had never entered into the specified SFT; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: value the exposure in accordance with the applicable provision in Division 5.

section.name: s67A
section.heading: Outstanding transaction in securities, foreign exchange or commodities

subsection.content: If any transaction in securities, foreign exchange or commodities (other than a repo-style transaction) that is entered into by an authorized institution on a delivery-versus-payment basis is outstanding on or after the 5th business day after the settlement date of that transaction, the institution must recognize an exposure to the counterparty to the transaction at the positive current exposure incurred by the institution under the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: If any transaction in securities, foreign exchange or commodities (other than a repo-style transaction) that is entered into by an authorized institution on a basis other than a delivery-versus-payment basis is outstanding after the settlement date of that transaction, the institution must recognize an exposure to the counterparty to the transaction as the sum of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of payment made, or the current market value of the thing delivered, by the institution under the transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any positive current exposure incurred by the institution under the transaction.

subsection.content: This rule applies to the valuation of a non-CCR exposure arising from an option contract entered into by an authorized institution.
The exposure is valued at the gross jump-to-default risk amount in accordance with rule 71C. (L.N. 169 of 2023)
This rule applies to the valuation of a non-CCR exposure to a counterparty arising from an item for which the counterparty acts as a CCP.
A clearing-related non-CCR exposure listed in Table B must be valued by using the method or at the amount specified in column 2 of Table B opposite the exposure.
This rule applies to the valuation of a non-CCR exposure arising from a covered bond held by an authorized institution.

subsection.leadIn: The exposure must be valued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the nominal value of the covered bond; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if all conditions in subrule (3) are met at the inception of the covered bond and throughout its remaining maturity—at 30% of the nominal value.

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (2)(b), the conditions are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the pool of the covered bond’s underlying assets (cover pool) exclusively consists of claims falling within the following description—

subparagraph.content: a claim on, or guaranteed by, a sovereign, a public sector entity or a multilateral development bank;
a claim that, if it had been incurred by the institution, would constitute a regulatory real estate exposure that would fall within section 65B of the Capital Rules, where—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the exposure would qualify for a risk-weight of 35% or lower under that section; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the exposure in aggregate has a loan-to-value ratio of 80% or lower; (L.N. 169 of 2023)
a claim that, if it had been incurred by the institution, would constitute a regulatory real estate exposure that would fall within section 65C of the Capital Rules, where—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the exposure would qualify for a risk-weight of 100% or lower under that section; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the exposure in aggregate has a loan-to-value ratio of 60% or lower; (L.N. 169 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), the ratio of the nominal value of the cover pool assigned by the issuer to cover the issuer’s obligations under the covered bonds to the outstanding amount of the nominal value of the covered bonds exceeds 110%;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the ratio mentioned in paragraph (b) becomes less than 110% but not less than 100%, the shortfall is covered by—

subparagraph.content: assets that are of the same type as that of the underlying assets;
liquid and high-quality assets (for example, cash or marketable debt securities); or
derivative contracts entered into by the issuer for hedging the risks arising from the covered bonds.

subsection.content: For calculating the loan-to-value ratio for a regulatory real estate exposure mentioned in subrule (3)(a)(ii) or (iii), section 206(i) and (j) of the Capital Rules must be complied with for valuing the collateral and for monitoring and reviewing the value of the collateral, as if those provisions were applicable to the issuer of the covered bond. (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: covered bond (資產覆蓋債券) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Capital Rules, with the modification that the reference to the calculation of the risk-weighted amount for credit risk is treated as a reference to the calculation of the value of an exposure; (L.N. 169 of 2023)
loan-to-value ratio (貸款與價值比率) means the amount of the exposure divided by the value of the residential or non-residential property securing the exposure; (L.N. 169 of 2023)
regulatory real estate exposure (監管地產風險承擔) has the same meaning as in section 65(1) of the Capital Rules. (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.content: This rule applies to the valuation of the non-CCR exposures arising from an investment structure held by an authorized institution.

subsection.leadIn: If the value of the exposure to each asset underlying the investment structure, valued by the method mentioned in subrule (6), is less than 0.25% of the amount of the institution’s Tier 1 capital, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign an exposure arising from the investment structure as an exposure to a distinct counterparty and value the exposure at the current book value of the institution’s investment in the investment structure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assign an exposure to each asset underlying the investment structure and value each exposure by the method mentioned in subrule (6).

subsection.leadIn: If the value of the exposure to 1 or more assets underlying the investment structure, valued by the method mentioned in subrule (6), equals to or exceeds 0.25% of the amount of the institution’s Tier 1 capital, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assign an exposure to that asset or each of those assets and value each exposure by the method mentioned in subrule (6); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the remaining assets underlying the investment structure—

subparagraph.leadIn: assign an exposure arising from those remaining assets as an exposure to a distinct counterparty and value the exposure as follows—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: first, assume that an exposure is assigned to each of those remaining assets and value each of those exposures by the method mentioned in subrule (6); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: second, add together the values of exposures mentioned in sub-subparagraph (A); or
assign an exposure to each of the remaining assets and value each exposure by the method mentioned in subrule (6).

subsection.leadIn: If the institution is unable to identify the underlying assets of the investment structure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case that the current book value of the institution’s investment in the investment structure is less than 0.25% of the amount of the institution’s Tier 1 capital, the institution must—

subparagraph.content: assign the exposure arising from the investment structure as an exposure to a distinct counterparty; and
value the exposure at the current book value of the institution’s investment in the investment structure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case, the institution must—

subparagraph.content: assign the exposure as an exposure to a hypothetical counterparty called the “unknown client” and value the exposure at the current book value of the institution’s investment in the investment structure; and
add all exposures to the unknown client as if they were related to a counterparty, to which rule 44(1) applies.

subsection.content: An authorized institution must not enter into a scheme to avoid the application of subrule (3), with a view to circumventing a limit prescribed under rule 44(1) or (2).

statutoryNote.heading: Example—
statutoryNote.content: Investing in several individually immaterial investment structures with identical underlying assets.

subsection.leadIn: If, under subrule (2) or (3), an exposure assigned to an underlying asset (asset A) is to be valued by the method mentioned in this subrule, the exposure must be valued as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the rights of all the investors in the investment structure are identical, by using Formula 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if there are differences in seniority levels among the investors in the investment structure, by multiplying the following—

subparagraph.content: the share of the institution’s investment in the tranche, expressed as a percentage;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the nominal value of the tranche of the investment structure in which the institution holds an interest; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the nominal value of each underlying asset in the portfolio of assets underlying the investment structure.

subsection.content: Formula 4 is as follows—

subsection.continued:
where—
E(A)
=the value of the institution’s exposure to asset A underlying the investment structure;
SA
=the total value of the investment structure’s exposure to asset A as reported in the latest financial report of the investment structure;
NAVAI
=the net asset value of the share of the institution’s holding of interests in the investment structure;
NAVS
=the net asset value of the investment structure; and
BV
=the current book value of the institution’s holding of interests in the investment structure.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, an authorized institution’s exposure to a counterparty, arising from an asset underlying an investment structure, must be included in the institution’s non-CCR exposures to the counterparty in determining the institution’s ASC exposure to the counterparty.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: tranche (份額) means a contractually established segment (relevant segment) of the credit risk associated with a pool of underlying exposures in a securitization transaction, or in a transaction of a similar structure, if—(a)a position in the relevant segment entails a risk of credit loss greater than, or less than, that of a position of the same amount in each other contractually established segment; and(b)no account is taken of any credit protection provided by third parties directly to the holders of positions in the relevant segment or in other contractually established segments.

subsection.content: This rule applies to the valuation of an off-balance sheet exposure of an authorized institution to a counterparty arising from unsegregated collateral posted by the institution to the counterparty for a transaction or contract booked in the institution’s banking book or trading book.

subsection.leadIn: The exposure must be valued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the institution uses the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures—at the credit equivalent amount calculated in accordance with the relevant provisions for unsegregated collateral set out in Division 4 of Part 5 of the Capital Rules; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution uses the STC approach, or a combination of the STC approach and IRB approach, to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures—at the credit equivalent amount calculated in accordance with the relevant provisions for unsegregated collateral set out in Division 4 of Part 4 of the Capital Rules.

subdivision.name: SD3A
subdivision.heading: Non-CCR Exposure (Trading Book): Authorized Institution that Uses STM Approach or IMA for Market Risk

section.name: s71B
section.heading: Application of Subdivision 3A
section.content: This Subdivision applies to a non-CCR exposure arising from an item in the trading book (relevant exposure) of an authorized institution that uses the STM approach, IMA, or a combination of the STM approach and IMA, to calculate its regulatory capital for market risk, unless Subdivision 3 contains a provision that specifically provides for the valuation of the exposure.

subsection.content: Subject to the modifications set out in subrule (2), an authorized institution must calculate the gross jump-to-default risk amount in respect of a relevant exposure of the institution to a counterparty in accordance with section 281U of the Capital Rules as if the institution were calculating the SA-DRC (non-securitization) under the STM approach.

subsection.leadIn: The modifications referred to in subrule (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a loss given default of 100% must be assigned to the relevant exposure; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any adjustment in relation to the maturity of an exposure under section 281U of the Capital Rules does not apply.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: relevant exposure (有關風險承擔)—see rule 71B;
SA-DRC (non-securitization) (SA-DRC(非證券化)) has the meaning given by section 281 of the Capital Rules.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Non-CCR Exposure (Trading Book): Authorized Institution that does not Fall within Subdivision 3A

section.name: s72
section.heading: Application of Subdivision 4
section.content: This Subdivision applies to a non-CCR exposure arising from an item in the trading book of an authorized institution that does not fall within Subdivision 3A.

section.name: s73
section.heading: General—current book value
section.content: A non-CCR exposure, arising from an item in an authorized institution’s trading book, must be valued at the item’s current book value, unless this Subdivision or Subdivision 3 contains a provision that specifically provides for the valuation of the exposure.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Shares or debt securities
section.content: A non-CCR exposure arising from the holding of shares or debt securities must be valued at the current market value of the shares or debt securities.

subsection.leadIn: This rule applies to a non-CCR exposure arising from any of the following derivative contracts entered into by an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a futures contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a forward contract;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a swap contract.

subsection.leadIn: The exposure must be valued as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: first, the contract must be decomposed into individual legs in accordance with sections 289(2)(c)(i), (ii) and (iii) and 292(1)(c), (d) and (e) of the Capital Rules, as if those provisions were applicable to the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: second—

subparagraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), only legs representing non-CCR exposures are to be included as an exposure; and
each of those legs must be valued at the fair value of the relevant underlying asset of the contract; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: third, a leg representing an exposure to an underlying basket of securities or securities index under the contract (underlying basket) must be measured in accordance with rule 71 as if the underlying basket were an investment structure held by the institution with the modifications that—

subparagraph.content: a reference to the current book value of the institution’s investment in the investment structure is treated as the fair value of the underlying basket; and
Formula 4 is to be replaced by Formula 5.

subsection.content: Formula 5 is as follows—

subsection.continued:
where—
E(A)
=the value of the institution’s exposure arising from a security (security A) underlying the investment structure;
W
=the weight of security A in the underlying basket of securities or securities index mentioned in subrule (4); and
FV
=the fair value of the underlying basket of securities or securities index mentioned in subrule (4).

subsection.leadIn: For Formula 5—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the weight of a security in a basket of securities is the ratio of the fair value of that security to the aggregate fair value of all the securities in the basket of securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the weight of a security in a securities index is the weight of the security in the securities index as specified by the index provider that compiles the index; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the fair value of a securities index equals to—

subparagraph.leadIn: the current index value multiplied by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for a futures contract, the monetary value of 1 index point set by the futures exchange where the futures contract is traded; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in any other case, the monetary value of 1 index point as agreed by the counterparties of the derivatives contract; or
the fair value of the underlying basket of securities by reference to which the index is compiled.

subsection.content: If an individual leg is an exposure treated as arising from a zero-coupon specific risk-free security, that exposure may be excluded.

subsection.leadIn: In subrule (5)—
subsection.def: specific risk-free security (無特定風險證券) has the meaning given by section 281 of the Capital Rules.

subsection.content: This rule applies to a non-CCR exposure arising from a credit derivative contract entered into by an authorized institution.

For a credit derivative contract other than an nth-to-default credit derivative contract under which the institution is the protection seller, the institution must value an exposure to the reference entity, arising from the contract, at the amount due in the case a credit event specified in the contract occurs minus the absolute mark-to-market value of the credit derivative contract.

subsection.leadIn: For an nth-to-default credit derivative contract under which the institution is the protection seller, the institution must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: value the exposure, arising from each of the basket of reference obligations, to the relevant reference entity by using Formula 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: value the exposure, arising from each of the basket of reference obligations, to the relevant reference entity in the full nominal amount of the contract.

subsection.content: Formula 6 is as follows—

subsection.continued:
where—
E
=the value of the institution’s exposure to the relevant reference entity;
N
=the notional amount of the contract; and
n
=the number of reference obligations that need to default to trigger payment by the protection seller.

subsection.content: This rule applies to a non-CCR exposure arising from a derivative contract entered into by an authorized institution, unless this Division contains a provision that specifically provides for the valuation of the exposure.

If the exposure to the underlying obligor of a derivative contract arises from a long position under the contract, the exposure must be valued at the amount that the institution would lose if the underlying obligor were to immediately default.

If the exposure to the underlying obligor of a derivative contract arises from a short position under the contract, the exposure must be valued at the amount that the institution would gain if the underlying obligator were to immediately default.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Valuation of CRM Uncovered Portion of Exposure

section.name: s78
section.heading: Application of Division 6
section.content: This Division applies to the valuation of the CRM uncovered portion of a CRM covered exposure, for an adjustment under Subdivision 2 of Division 3.

subsection.content: This rule applies to an exposure of an authorized institution that is covered by a recognized netting done under a valid bilateral netting agreement.

The CRM uncovered portion of the exposure is valued at its net credit exposure calculated by using Formula 7 under section 94 of the Capital Rules, subject to the maturity mismatches provisions under section 103(1) and (3) of the Capital Rules, as if that Formula and those provisions were applicable to the institution.
This rule applies to an exposure of an authorized institution that is covered by a recognized collateral.

subsection.leadIn: If the institution uses the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures, the CRM uncovered portion of the exposure is valued as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an exposure that is not an off-balance sheet exposure to which rule 65 applies—by using Formula 7;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an exposure that is an off-balance sheet exposure to which rule 65 applies—by using Formula 7, with the modification that “current market value of recognized collateral” in that Formula is multiplied by the CCF applicable to that off-balance sheet exposure as determined under rule 65. (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.content: Formula 7 is as follows—

paragraph.content: max [0, (original exposure – current market value of recognized collateral)]

subsection.continued:
where—
original exposure
=the value of the exposure as calculated according to this Part, but for this Division.

subsection.leadIn: If the institution uses the STC approach, or a combination of the STC approach and IRB approach, to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures, the CRM uncovered portion of the exposure is valued as follows— (L.N. 169 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to rule 48B(3), for an exposure with respect to which the simple approach is used to account for the credit risk mitigation effect of the recognized collateral—by using the same method under subrule (2)(a) or (b); (L.N. 169 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for an exposure with respect to which the comprehensive approach is used to account for the credit risk mitigation effect of the recognized collateral—at the following value— (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subparagraph.leadIn: for an exposure that does not fall within subparagraph (ii)—the net credit exposure in Formula 2 under section 87 of, or Formula 4 under section 89 of, the Capital Rules (as the case requires, depending on the nature of the exposure), subject to— (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the applicable haircut provisions of the Capital Rules if the recognized collateral consists of a basket of securities under section 90 of the Capital Rules; and
section 103(1), (3) and (4) of the Capital Rules; and
section 103(2) of the Capital Rules, with the modification that the reference to calculating a risk-weighted amount is treated as a reference to calculating the value of an exposure,

subparagraph.leadIn: for an off-balance sheet exposure (other than a default risk exposure in respect of derivative contracts)—the net credit exposure in Formula 3 under section 88(1) of the Capital Rules as adjusted (where applicable) under section 88(2) of the Capital Rules, subject to— (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.leadIn: the modification that the CCF as determined under that Formula is subject to a floor of 10%; (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the applicable haircut provisions of the Capital Rules if the recognized collateral consists of a basket of securities under section 90 of the Capital Rules; and
section 103(1), (3) and (4) of the Capital Rules; and
section 103(2) of the Capital Rules, with the modification that the reference to calculating a risk-weighted amount is treated as a reference to calculating the value of an exposure,

subparagraph.continued: as if that Formula and those provisions of the Capital Rules were applicable to the institution.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Recognized guarantee or recognized credit derivative contract

subsection.content: This rule applies to an exposure of an authorized institution that is covered by a recognized guarantee or recognized credit derivative contract.
The CRM uncovered portion of the exposure is valued by using Formula 8.
Formula 8 is as follows—

paragraph.content: max {0, (original exposure – G × (1 – Hfx))}

subsection.continued:
where—
original exposure
=the value of the exposure as calculated according to this Part, but for this Division;
G
=the maximum liability of the credit protection provider to the institution under the credit protection (subject to the maturity mismatch provisions specified in subrule (4)); and
Hfx
=the haircut applicable in consequence of a currency mismatch, if any, under the standard supervisory haircut specified in Schedule 7 of the Capital Rules, subject to adjustment as set out in section 92 of the Capital Rules.

subsection.leadIn: The following maturity mismatch provisions are specified for determining the value of G in Formula 8, as if the provisions were applicable to the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 103(1), (3) and (4) of the Capital Rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 103(2) of the Capital Rules, with the modification that the reference to calculating a risk-weighted amount is treated as a reference to calculating the value of an exposure.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, for a recognized credit derivative contract to which any of the following sections of the Capital Rules is applicable, the value of G in Formula 8 is capped at the maximum amount of the contract that may be recognized under that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 99(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 99(4);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 99B(3)(a);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 99B(3)(b). (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.content: This rule applies to an exposure that is covered by a credit-linked note.

subsection.leadIn: The CRM uncovered portion of the exposure is valued by the method set out in rule 80 as if the exposure were—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: covered by a recognized collateral; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: secured by the amount of sales proceeds of the note as cash deposits.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: ACNP exposure (ACNP風險承擔) means an aggregate connected natural persons exposure;
ACNPE ratio (ACNPE比率) means an aggregate connected natural persons exposure ratio;
ACP exposure (ACP風險承擔) means an aggregate connected parties exposure;
ACPE ratio (ACPE比率) means an aggregate connected parties exposure ratio;
aggregate connected natural persons exposure (所有關連自然人總風險承擔)—see rule 91;

aggregate connected natural persons exposure ratio (所有關連自然人總風險承擔比率), in relation to an authorized institution, means the ratio, expressed as a percentage, of the institution’s ACNP exposure, to the amount of the institution’s Tier 1 capital;
aggregate connected parties exposure (關連各方總風險承擔)—see rule 90;

aggregate connected parties exposure ratio (關連各方總風險承擔比率), in relation to an authorized institution, means the ratio, expressed as a percentage, of the institution’s ACP exposure, to the amount of the institution’s Tier 1 capital;
aggregate single connected party exposure (單一關連一方總風險承擔)—see rule 89;
ASCP exposure (ASCP風險承擔) means an aggregate single connected party exposure;

connected natural person (關連自然人), in relation to an authorized institution, means a natural person who is a connected party of the institution within the meaning of rule 85(1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f);
connected party (關連一方)—see rule 85;
non-listed company (非上市公司) means a company not listed on a recognized stock market, but does not include a statutory corporation that is specified in Schedule 3;
recognized stock market (認可證券市場) means a stock market as defined by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, an expression specified below has the meaning given by rule 39(1)—

paragraph.content: ASC exposure (ASC風險承擔);
Category A institution (A類機構);
Category B institution (B類機構);
CRM covered exposure (CRM涵蓋風險承擔);
entity (實體);
exposure (風險承擔);
recognized collateral (認可抵押品);
recognized CRM (認可CRM).

subsection.leadIn: For this Part, in relation to an authorized institution, each of the following entities is a connected party of the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director of the institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a relative of a natural person who is a director of the institution;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: a relative of an employee described in paragraph (c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: subject to subrule (2), a controller or minority shareholder controller of the institution;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a relative of a natural person who is a controller or minority shareholder controller of the institution;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subrule (2), a firm, partnership or non-listed company in which the institution or any of the following entities is interested as a director, partner, manager or agent—

subparagraph.content: a controller, minority shareholder controller or director of the institution;
a relative of a natural person who is a controller, minority shareholder controller or director of the institution;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: a natural person, firm, partnership or non-listed company to whom the institution has provided a financial facility, if any of the following entities is a guarantor of the facility—

subparagraph.content: a controller, minority shareholder controller or director of the institution;
a relative of a natural person who is a controller, minority shareholder controller or director of the institution.

subsection.leadIn: However, the following entity is not a connected party of an authorized institution even if it falls within the description of subrule (1)(e) or (g)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another authorized institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an entity approved under subrule (3). (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, in relation to an authorized institution, approve an entity for subrule (2)(b) if the Monetary Authority considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the entity falls within paragraph (b) of the definition of bank in section 2(1) of the Capital Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is reasonable to do so, having regard to any other factors that the Monetary Authority considers relevant. (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: adopted (領養) means adopted in a manner recognized by the laws of Hong Kong;

relative (親屬), in relation to a natural person, means the following—(a)a parent, grandparent or great grandparent;(b)a step-parent or adoptive parent;(c)a brother or sister;(d)the spouse;(e)if the person is a party to a union of concubinage—the other party of the union;(f)a cohabitee;(g)a parent, step-parent or adoptive parent of a spouse;(h)a brother or sister of a spouse;(i)a son, step-son, adopted son, daughter, step-daughter or adopted daughter;(j)a grandson, granddaughter, great grandson or great granddaughter;

union of concubinage (夫妾關係) means a union of concubinage entered into by a male partner and a female partner before 7 October 1971, under which union the female partner has, during the lifetime of the male partner, been accepted by his wife as his concubine and recognized as such by his family generally.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Application of Part 8
section.content: This Part applies to an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Limit on Exposure to Connected Party

section.name: s87
section.heading: Limit on exposure to connected party
section.leadIn: Subject to (if applicable) any variation under rule 88(1), an authorized institution must at all times maintain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an ACPE ratio not exceeding 15%;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an ACNPE ratio not exceeding 5%; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to each connected natural person of the institution—an ASCP exposure not exceeding $10,000,000.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Monetary Authority may vary limit on exposure to connected party

subsection.content: Subject to subrules (3), (4), (5) and (6), the Monetary Authority may, by written notice served on an authorized institution, vary any or all of the limits prescribed under rule 87(a), (b) and (c) for the institution if the Monetary Authority, after taking into account the considerations set out in subrule (2), is satisfied on reasonable grounds that it is prudent to make the variation.

subsection.leadIn: The considerations are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risks associated with the level or concentration of the institution’s exposures to its connected parties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any risk mitigation measures taken by the institution to manage those risks;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the risks associated with those measures; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other factors that the Monetary Authority considers relevant.

subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority proposes to serve a notice (proposed notice) under subrule (1) on an authorized institution, the Monetary Authority must serve a draft of the notice (draft notice) on the institution.

subsection.leadIn: A draft notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: specify—

subparagraph.content: the proposed variation of the limit concerned; and
the circumstances pertaining to, and the grounds for, the proposed variation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain a statement that the institution may, within 14 days (or a longer period approved by the Monetary Authority in writing in any particular case) from the date of service of the draft notice, make written representation to the Monetary Authority on any or all of the matters specified in the draft notice.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution makes any written representation in relation to a draft notice served on it, the Monetary Authority may, after considering the representation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: serve a notice on the institution under subrule (1) in substantially the same terms as the draft notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve a notice on the institution under subrule (1) in terms modified to take account of the representation on being satisfied that the modification should be made; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: elect not to serve a notice on the institution under subrule (1) if satisfied by the representation that the proposed notice should not be served on the institution.

subsection.content: If no representation is made by an authorized institution in relation to a draft notice served on it, the Monetary Authority may serve a notice on the institution under subrule (1) in substantially the same terms as the draft notice.
A decision of the Monetary Authority under subrule (1) is a decision to which section 101B(1) of the Ordinance applies.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority may serve a draft notice on an authorized institution to supersede an earlier draft notice served on the institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference to same terms in subrule (5)(a) or (6) does not include the statement mentioned in subrule (4)(b).

division.name: D3
division.heading: Determination of Exposure to Connected Parties

section.name: s89
section.heading: Aggregate single connected party exposure (ASCP exposure)
section.content: An authorized institution’s ASCP exposure to a connected party of the institution is the same as the institution’s ASC exposure to the party, determined in accordance with rule 46, subject to any modification under Division 4.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Aggregate connected parties exposure (ACP exposure)
section.content: For calculating an authorized institution’s ACPE ratio under this Part, the ACP exposure of the institution is the sum of the institution’s ASCP exposure to all of its connected parties.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Aggregate connected natural persons exposure (ACNP exposure)
section.content: For calculating an authorized institution’s ACNPE ratio under this Part, the ACNP exposure of the institution is the sum of the institution’s ASCP exposure to all of its connected natural persons.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may give a written consent to allow an exposure or a class of exposures not to be taken into account for determining an authorized institution’s ASCP exposure to a connected party, if the Monetary Authority considers that it is reasonable to do so, having regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of, and the risks associated with, the exposure or class of exposures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any risk mitigation measures taken by the institution to manage those risks;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the risks associated with those measures; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other factors that the Monetary Authority considers relevant.

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a written consent under subrule (1) to an authorized institution or a class of authorized institutions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attach conditions to the consent.

subsection.content: For determining an ASCP exposure to a connected party in accordance with rule 46, by virtue of rule 89, subrules (2) and (3) modify the provisions in Part 7 for the valuation of a CRM covered exposure.

subsection.leadIn: If an exposure of a Category B institution to a connected party is covered by a recognized CRM— (L.N. 169 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rule 50 applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rule 51 does not apply,

subsection.continued: as if the institution were a Category A institution, even if it is a Category B institution.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting any provision in Part 7, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any interest in land—

subparagraph.content: is so pledged or provided for a period not shorter than the life of the item; and
is revalued by the institution at least once every 6 months during the life of the item; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the criteria specified in section 77(2) of the Capital Rules are met, (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.continued: the interest in land is treated as if it were a recognized collateral for valuing the exposure in this Part, the value of which is determined in accordance with subrule (4). (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.content: If the recognized collateral of a CRM covered exposure of an authorized institution is in the form of an interest in land that meets all the requirements of subrule (3), the CRM uncovered portion of the exposure is valued by using Formula 9. (L.N. 169 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Formula 9 is as follows—

td.p: max [0, (original exposure – current market value of interest in land)]
subject to rule 93A, the value of the exposure as calculated according to Part 7.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: CRM uncovered portion (CRM不涵蓋部分) has the meaning given by rule 39(1). (L.N. 169 of 2023)

section.name: s93A
section.heading: Calculation of ASCP exposure of connected party
section.content: For determining an ASCP exposure of an authorized institution to a connected party in accordance with rule 46, the institution must disregard rule 48(1)(a).

section.name: s94
section.heading: Exposure to 2 or more entities etc.

subsection.content: If an exposure of an authorized institution is to 2 or more entities jointly, rule 87(c) applies as if the exposure were to each of those entities severally.

subsection.leadIn: For rule 87(b) and (c), if a natural person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: controls a firm, partnership or non-listed company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a connected natural person of an authorized institution,

subsection.continued: an exposure of the institution to the firm, partnership or non-listed company is treated as an exposure to the person.

subsection.leadIn: For subrule (2)(a), a firm, partnership or non-listed company (controlled entity) is treated as being controlled by a natural person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person owns more than 50% of the voting rights in the controlled entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has control of a majority of the voting rights in the controlled entity under an agreement with other shareholders (or similar holders of voting rights);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has the right to appoint or remove a majority of the members of the controlled entity’s board of directors (or a similar governing body);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a majority of the members of the controlled entity’s board of directors (or a similar governing body) have been appointed solely as a result of the person exercising his or her voting rights; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the person has the power, under a contract or otherwise, to exercise a controlling influence over the management or policies of the controlled entity.

part.name: P9
part.heading: Repeal and Transitional and Savings Provisions

section.name: s95
section.heading: Banking (Exposure Limits) Rules repealed
section.content: The Banking (Exposure Limits) Rules (Cap. 155 sub. leg. R) are repealed.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 2
section.def: repealed Rules (《已廢除規則》) means the Banking (Exposure Limits) Rules (Cap. 155 sub. leg. R).

section.name: s97
section.heading: Application of rule 11 on unconsolidated basis or consolidated basis—deemed rule 6(1) notice

subsection.content: A former rule 5(1) notice given to an authorized institution is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a notice given to the institution under rule 6(1) on that date requiring it to apply rule 11 on the basis specified in the former rule 5(1) notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: former rule 5(1) notice (前第5(1)條通知) means—(a)a notice given under rule 5(1) of the repealed Rules requiring an authorized institution to apply rule 10 of the repealed Rules on the basis specified in the notice; or(b)a notice deemed to be given under rule 5(1) of the repealed Rules, by virtue of rule 21(2) of the repealed Rules, requiring an authorized institution to calculate its aggregate equity exposures of the repealed Rules on the basis specified in the notice.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Variation of equity exposure limit—deemed rule 12(1) notice

subsection.content: A former variation notice served on an authorized institution is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a notice served on the institution under rule 12(1) on that date.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subrule (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a former draft notice served on an authorized institution before 1 July 2019 is deemed to be a draft notice served on the institution under rule 12(3) on that date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a written representation made by the institution in relation to the former draft notice is deemed to be a written representation made by the institution in relation to the deemed draft notice.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a draft notice deemed to be served on an authorized institution under rule 12(3) by virtue of subrule (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rule 12(4)(b) does not apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in making a decision under rule 12(5), the Monetary Authority—

subparagraph.content: must consider representation made by the institution within the original representation period; and
may, but is not obliged, consider any representation made by the institution after the expiry of the original representation period.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: former draft notice (前通知草擬本) means a draft notice—(a)served under rule 11(3) of the repealed Rules; and(b)in relation to which the Monetary Authority had not made a decision under rule 11(5) or (6) of the repealed Rules before 1 July 2019;
former variation notice (前更改通知) means a notice served under rule 11(1) of the repealed Rules;

original representation period (原申述期間), in relation to a former draft notice, means the following period, whichever is the longer—(a)the 14-day period mentioned in rule 11(4)(b) of the repealed Rules;(b)where a longer period was allowed under rule 11(4)(b) of the repealed Rules—the longer period.

subsection.leadIn: Subrule (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a longer period was—

subparagraph.content: approved; or
deemed to be approved, by virtue of rule 22(1) of the repealed Rules,

paragraph.continued: under rule 13(1)(b)(ii) of the repealed Rules in relation to any share capital; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period had, immediately before 1 July 2019, yet to expire.

subsection.content: In relation to the share capital mentioned in subrule (1)(a), the portion of the period beginning on 1 July 2019 is deemed to be a longer period approved under rule 14(1)(b)(i)(B) on that date.

subsection.leadIn: Subrule (4) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a longer period was—

subparagraph.content: approved; or
deemed to be approved, by virtue of rule 22(2) of the repealed Rules,

paragraph.continued: under rule 13(1)(c)(i)(B) of the repealed Rules in relation to any share capital; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period had, immediately before 1 July 2019, yet to expire.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to the share capital mentioned in subrule (3)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the portion of the period beginning on 1 July 2019 is deemed to be a longer period approved under rule 14(1)(c)(i)(B) on that date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition attached to the earlier approval is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a condition attached to the deemed approval on that date.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approval was given, or deemed to be given by virtue of rule 22(3) of the repealed Rules, under rule 13(1)(e) of the repealed Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approval was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019,

subsection.continued: the approval is deemed to be an approval given under rule 14(1)(e) on 1 July 2019.

subsection.leadIn: If a former rule 13(2) consent given to an authorized institution was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former rule 13(2) consent is deemed to be a consent given to the institution under rule 14(2) on 1 July 2019; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition imposed on the former rule 13(2) consent is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a condition attached to the deemed consent on that date.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: former rule 13(2) consent (前第13(2)條同意) means a consent given under rule 13(2) of the repealed Rules.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Transitional and Savings Provisions (Acquisition of Share Capital of Company)

section.name: s102
section.heading: Application of rule 23 on unconsolidated basis or consolidated basis—deemed rule 6(1) notice

subsection.content: A former section 79A notice given to an authorized institution is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a notice given under rule 6(1) to the institution on that date requiring it to apply rule 23 on the basis specified in the former section 79A notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: former section 79A notice (前第79A條通知) means a notice given under section 79A of the Ordinance requiring an authorized institution to apply section 87A of the Ordinance on a certain basis.

subsection.leadIn: If a former section 87A(2)(a) approval given to an authorized institution was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approval is deemed to be a consent given to the institution under rule 24(1) on 1 July 2019;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition attached to the approval is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a condition attached to the deemed consent on that date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a condition is deemed to be attached to the deemed consent on 1 July 2019 requiring the institution to come to hold the share capital, that is the subject matter of approval, no later than 30 September 2019.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, if the institution had already come to hold the share capital, that is the subject matter of the former section 87A(2)(a) approval, before 1 July 2019, the institution may not acquire further share capital under the consent deemed to be given under rule 24(1), but is still subject to the condition (if any) mentioned in subrule (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: former section 87A(2)(a) approval (前第87A(2)(a)條批准) means—(a)an approval given under section 87A(2)(a) of the Ordinance; or(b)an approval deemed to be granted under section 87A(2)(a) of the Ordinance, by virtue of section 87A(3) of the Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Subrule (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a further period was approved under section 87A(8) of the Ordinance in relation to any share capital; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period had, immediately before 1 July 2019, yet to expire.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to the share capital mentioned in subrule (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the portion of the period beginning on 1 July 2019 is deemed to be a longer period approved under rule 23(3)(a)(ii) on that date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition attached to the earlier approval is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a condition attached to the deemed approval on that date.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Transitional and Savings Provisions (Financial Facility against Security of Own Shares etc.)

section.name: s105
section.heading: Financial facility against security of authorized institution’s capital-in-nature instrument etc.—application of rule 27(1) and (2)

subsection.leadIn: If, before 1 July 2019—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an authorized institution provided a financial facility against the security of a capital-in-nature instrument, or non-capital LAC debt instrument, issued by—

subparagraph.content: the institution;
a holding company of the institution;
a subsidiary of the institution; or
a subsidiary of a holding company of the institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the financial facility is still in effect at the beginning of 1 July 2019,

subsection.continued: rule 27(1) and (2) does not apply in relation to the financial facility.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: capital-in-nature instrument (資本類票據) has the meaning given by rule 25(1);
non-capital LAC debt instrument (非資本LAC債務票據) has the meaning given by rule 25(1).

section.name: s106
section.heading: Financial facility against security of own shares etc. issued by associated company—deemed rule 28(1) consent

subsection.leadIn: If an approval under section 80(2) of the Ordinance given to an authorized institution was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approval is deemed to be a consent given to the institution under rule 28(1) on 1 July 2019; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition attached to the approval is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a condition attached to the deemed consent on that date.

subsection.content: The deemed consent ceases to have effect at the end of 30 September 2019.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Transitional and Savings Provision (Financial Facility Provided to Employee)

section.name: s107
section.heading: Unsecured financial facility to employee—deemed rule 32 consent
section.content: A consent under section 85(1) of the Ordinance is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a consent given under rule 32 on that date.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Transitional and Savings Provisions (Interest in Land)

section.name: s108
section.heading: Grace period for complying with rule 35(a)

subsection.content: This rule applies to an authorized institution if, immediately before 1 July 2019, its land exposure ratio, calculated as if these Rules had come into operation at that time, exceeded 50%.

subsection.leadIn: If, within the grace period, the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not contravene section 88 of the Ordinance as in force immediately before 1 July 2019; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not acquire any interest in land (except as described in rule 38(a) or (b)),

subsection.continued: the institution is treated as being compliant with rule 35(a) until the grace period expires.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: grace period (寬限期) means the period beginning on 1 July 2019 and expiring at the end of the earlier of the following dates—(a)30 September 2019;(b)the date on which the institution becomes compliant with rule 35(a) or (if applicable) that rule as varied under rule 36(1);
land exposure ratio (土地風險承擔比率) has the meaning given by rule 33.

section.name: s109
section.heading: Application of rule 35 on unconsolidated basis or consolidated basis—deemed rule 6(1) notice

subsection.content: A former section 79A notice given to an authorized institution is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a notice given under rule 6(1) to the institution on that date requiring it to apply rule 35 on the basis specified in the former section 79A notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: former section 79A notice (前第79A條通知) means a notice given under section 79A of the Ordinance requiring an authorized institution to apply section 88 of the Ordinance on a certain basis.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Premises for conducting authorized institution’s business—deemed rule 37(3) consent
section.content: If, immediately before 1 July 2019, the Monetary Authority regarded under section 88(3) of the Ordinance the whole of any premises in which an office of an authorized institution is situated as necessary for conducting the business of the institution, a consent is deemed to be given under rule 37(3) on 1 July 2019 to allow the institution to treat the whole of the premises as being used for conducting the institution’s business.

section.name: s111
section.heading: Longer period—deemed rule 38(b)(i)(B) approval

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a further period was allowed under section 88(5) of the Ordinance in relation to an interest in land; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period had, immediately before 1 July 2019, yet to expire,

section.continued: the portion of the period beginning on 1 July 2019 is deemed to be a longer period approved under rule 38(b)(i)(B) on that date.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Transitional and Savings Provisions (Single Counterparty and Group of Linked Counterparties)

section.name: s112
section.heading: Grace period for complying with rule 44(1)(a)

subsection.leadIn: If, at a particular time during the grace period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution’s ASCE ratio, in relation to a counterparty of it, exceeds the limit prescribed under rule 44(1)(a) or (if applicable) that rule as varied under rule 45(1); but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution does not, in relation to the counterparty, contravene section 81(1)(a) of the Ordinance as in force immediately before 1 July 2019,

subsection.continued: the institution is treated as being compliant, at that time, with rule 44(1)(a) or (if applicable) that rule as varied under rule 45(1), in relation to the counterparty.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: ASCE ratio (ASCE比率) has the meaning given by rule 39(1);
grace period (寬限期) means the period beginning on 1 July 2019 and expiring at the end of 31 December 2019.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Grace period for complying with rule 44(1)(b)

subsection.leadIn: If, at a particular time during the grace period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution’s ALCGE ratio, in relation to an LC group of it, exceeds the limit prescribed under rule 44(1)(b) or (if applicable) that rule as varied under rule 45(1); but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution does not, in relation to the entities in the group, contravene section 81(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d) of the Ordinance as in force immediately before 1 July 2019,

subsection.continued: the institution is treated as being compliant, at that time, with rule 44(1)(b) or (if applicable) that rule as varied under rule 45(1), in relation to the group.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: ALCGE ratio (ALCGE比率) has the meaning given by rule 39(1);
grace period (寬限期) means the period beginning on 1 July 2019 and expiring at the end of 31 December 2019;
LC group (LC集團) has the meaning given by rule 39(1).

section.name: s114
section.heading: Application of rule 44 on unconsolidated basis or consolidated basis—deemed rule 6(1) notice

subsection.content: A former section 79A notice given to an authorized institution is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a notice given under rule 6(1) to the institution on that date requiring it to apply rule 44 on the basis specified in the former section 79A notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this rule—
subsection.def: former section 79A notice (前第79A條通知) means a notice given under section 79A of the Ordinance requiring an authorized institution to apply section 81 of the Ordinance on a certain basis.

subsection.leadIn: If a letter of comfort was accepted by the Monetary Authority under section 81(6)(b)(ii) of the Ordinance and the acceptance was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the acceptance is deemed to be an approval of the letter of comfort given under rule 57(1)(d)(i) on 1 July 2019; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a condition attached to the acceptance is deemed, if it was in effect immediately before 1 July 2019, to be a condition attached to the deemed rule 57(1)(d)(i) approval on that date.

subsection.content: Subject to subrule (3), a deemed rule 57(1)(d)(i) approval ceases to have effect at the end of 30 June 2020.

subsection.leadIn: Subrule (2) does not apply to a deemed rule 57(1)(d)(i) approval of a letter of comfort that covers an exposure, arising from the 80% Loan Guarantee Product under the SME Financing Guarantee Scheme set up by The Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation Limited, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation Limited; or

paragraph.name: b
